title: priests
comment: A group of men charged with the responsibility of mediating between God and his people, ensuring proper worship, and maintaining the spiritual health of the people of God.

children.title: priests, institution in OT times
children.comment: Priests played an important role in the OT and were regarded as having a special status and place in the life of Israel.

children.title: Associated with the descendants of Levi through Aaron
The exclusive nature of the priesthood

primaryrefs.comment: Only God has the right to nominate those who mediate between him and humanity.

seealsos.comment: This genealogy shows Moses and Aaron were both descended from Levi

children.title: Criticism of priestly appointments that were not Levitical

seealsos.comment: Kings and priests also were anointed.

children.title: priests, function in OT times
children.comment: Priests had a unique role: administering the sanctuary, offering sacrifice and leading and teaching the people. Accordingly they were set apart by a special code of conduct.

children.title: They were consecrated to the LORD
They were not to incur uncleanness

primaryrefs.comment: Some exceptions to uncleanness by touching a corpse are listed in verses 2-3.

children.title: They were not to shave or mutilate themselves
They were not to marry any but a virtuous Israelite
They were not to drink wine before entering the sanctuary
They were disqualified by physical defects
They were not to allow outsiders to eat the sacred offerings
They were not to own land in Israel
They were not to offer unacceptable sacrifices
They were to obey God's law meticulously
They only had access to holy things
priests, types of in NT times
children.comment: The NT points to the fulfilment of the OT priesthood in Jesus Christ, and develops the idea that all Christian believers can be seen as priests. It also records the continuing role of priests in the life of Israel and pagan nations at this time.

primaryrefs.comment: The Sadducees were a conservative party composed entirely of priests who were influential in the Sanhedrin.
Levites were closely associated with priests as temple personnel, perhaps mentioned here because of their teaching function.

children.title: priests, tasks in NT times
children.comment: The priests mentioned in the NT performed various functions, all of which are fulfilled in Jesus Christ and the church, which is his body.

primaryrefs.comment: Jesus Christ is both priest and victim: his own body takes the place occupied by sacrifices in the OT ritual.

children.title: The Christian sacrifice of a surrendered life
They were trained in the teaching and application of OT law
Priests declared people clean or unclean
They supplied ritual certification of cleansing
